CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1949, p. 13, reads: "Centre Avenue Station Reopens - The racially mixed staff which appears in top left photo looked across the desk at the six white men, one colored women, and one white woman who appears for hearings at Centre Avenue Station on Tuesday morning following the reopening ceremonies at the station Monday night. They were the main reason for the rejoicing in the Negro community at the reopening ceremony for a remodeled 'lockup.'... Right, top photo: Superintendent of Police Harvey Scott and Director of Public Safety George E. A. Fairley look on as Mayor David Lawrence, playfully, tries cell door on 'inspection tour' as City Treasurer James Kirk stands in cell doorway... Other photos by Charles Harris."
TitMainTitle: Mayor David L. Lawrence shutting jail cell door on James Kirk, with Harvey Scott and Col. George Fairley on left, in Centre Avenue Police Station
CatSubject_tab: Lawrence, David Leo, 1889-1966.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Fairley, Col. George Edward Albert.Jails--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Interiors--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
